id: nhs111ambulancerequest-information-model

contact:

description: This message is a request for an ambulance to be dispatched. It contains the information from a NHS 111 encounter required for an ambulance service to be able to dispatch an ambulance.

jurisdiction: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (GBR) (Details : {http://unstats.un.org/unsd/methods/m49/m49.htm code '826' = 'United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (GBR))

start: ServiceRequest

profile: http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition/ServiceRequest

min: 0

max: *

description: A ServiceEvent can further specialize the act inherent in the ClinicalDocument.code, such as where the Composition.code is simply 'Procedure Report' and the procedure was a 'colonoscopy'.

target

type: ServiceRequest

description: (pertinent Information Questionnaire item?) It is used to indicate information about whether the patient has suffered trauma pertinent to the ambulance request.

Targets

*Flag

id: #fireFlag

path: Bundle.entry.resource[x]

min: 0

description: (pertinent Information Questionnaire item?) It is used to indicate information about whether there is a risk of fire at the incident scene pertinent to the ambulance request.

*Flag

link

id: #safeFlag

path: Bundle.entry.resource[x]

description: (pertinent Information Questionnaire item?) It is used to indicate information about whether the scene is safe pertinent to the ambulance request.

description: (pertinent Information Questionnaire item?) It is used to indicate information about whether police are in attendance at the incident scence pertinent to the ambulance request

link

id: #trappedFlag

path: Bundle.entry.resource[x]

max: 1

description: (pertinent Information Questionnaire item?) It is used to indicate information about whether the patient is trapped pertinent to the ambulance request.

*Flag

min: 1

max: 1

*Composition

name: Information Model - NHS 111 Ambulance Request
description: This message is a request for an ambulance to be dispatched. It contains the information from a NHS 111 encounter required for an ambulance service to be able to dispatch an ambulance.

link.description: A ServiceEvent can further specialize the act inherent in the ClinicalDocument.code, such as where the Composition.code is simply 'Procedure Report' and the procedure was a 'colonoscopy'.
The patient. This comes from Encounter in ITK but would also be from ServiceRequest in FHIR
This links the ambulance request to author of the request.
It is used for the list of recipients of the ambulance request message.

It is used when the ambulance request message is being replaced by an updated version. The new and previous ambulance request must be for the same NHS 111 case.(i.e. have the same case id). The ambulance request being sent replaces the one referenced in previous ambulance request class.
Justifying Triage Outcome
Triage Disposition
Clinical Discriminator
Used to carry additional notes pertinent to the ambulance request.
It is used to carry the Permission To View outcome.

It is used when the ambulance request message is being replaced by an updated version. The new and previous ambulance request must be for the same NHS 111 case.(i.e. have the same case id). The ambulance request being sent replaces the one referenced in previous ambulance request class.
It is used to indicate information about whether the patient has suffered trauma pertinent to the ambulance request.
It is used to indicate information about whether there is a risk of fire at the incident scene pertinent to the ambulance request.
It is used to indicate information about whether the scene is safe pertinent to the ambulance request.
It is used to indicate information about whether police are in attendance at the incident scence pertinent to the ambulance request
It is used to indicate information about whether the patient is trapped pertinent to the ambulance request.
Patient
It holds details of how and when the author authored the document.
It holds details of how and when the author authored the document.
Recieving Ambulance Service.
Triage Outcome (coded)
Triage Disposition (coded)
a concept from the NHS Pathways codes, or a text representation, to describe the clinical discriminator. This is the problem or serviceRequest.reasonCode
ITK Consent / ITK Permission to View Section
This is a component of relationship it is used to link the document header to the EncompassingEncounter that the document is documenting.
This is the location where the NHS 111 encounter call was made from by the patient or third party on behalf of the patient.
Possibly location of clinical discriminator (which appears to be the problem).
This is the location where the NHS 111 encounter call was made from by the patient or third party on behalf of the patient.
(pertinent Information Questionnaire item?) It is used to indicate information about whether the patient has suffered trauma pertinent to the ambulance request.
(pertinent Information Questionnaire item?) It is used to indicate information about whether there is a risk of fire at the incident scene pertinent to the ambulance request.
(pertinent Information Questionnaire item?) It is used to indicate information about whether the scene is safe pertinent to the ambulance request.
(pertinent Information Questionnaire item?) It is used to indicate information about whether police are in attendance at the incident scence pertinent to the ambulance request
(pertinent Information Questionnaire item?) It is used to indicate information about whether the patient is trapped pertinent to the ambulance request.
pertinent Information AdditionalNotes - this could be annotation in the serviceRequest
